reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app collects personal data for various purposes.
reply.reference: We may collect, use, and disclose your personal data for business purposes. Depending on the specific Therachat service or product you use, the categories of Personal Data collected may include: Personal identifiers, commercial information, and internet or other electronic activity. URL: https://therachat.freshdesk.com/support/solutions/articles/151000117681-therachat-privacy-policy

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app may collect personal identifiers, commercial information, internet or other electronic activity, and sensitive data revealing various personal aspects such as health diagnosis, sexual orientation, citizenship, or immigration status.

content: Personal identifiers (name, address, email, payment information)
Commercial information (products and services purchase records)
Internet or other electronic activity (interaction with websites, apps, advertisements)
Sensitive data (racial or ethnic origin, health diagnosis, sexual orientation, citizenship)

reply.analysis: The privacy policy document specifies the types of data that the app may collect, including personal identifiers, commercial information, electronic activity, and sensitive data. This information aligns with the details provided in the document.
reply.reference: Depending on the specific Therachat service or product you use, the categories of Personal Data collected may include Personal identifiers such as your name, address, email, and payment information, Commercial information such as the records of the products and services you purchase and use, and Internet or other electronic activity such as your interaction and usage with our websites, apps and advertisements and information about and on your device. Additionally, 'sensitive data', a category of personal data, would include the following: Personal data revealing racial or ethnic origin, religious beliefs, mental or physical health diagnosis, sexual orientation, citizenship, or immigrations status; URL: https://therachat.freshdesk.com/support/solutions/articles/151000117681-therachat-privacy-policy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?
reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that by using Therachat, users consent to the data practices described in the statement, indicating that the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.
reply.reference: The private information you provide on Therachat will be used only for its intended purpose. BY VISITING, SIGNING UP, USING AND ACCESSING THERACHAT, YOU CONSENT TO THE DATA PRACTICES DESCRIBED IN THIS STATEMENT. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE WITH OUT PRIVACY PRACTICES, DO NOT USE THERACHAT. URL: https://therachat.freshdesk.com/support/solutions/articles/151000117681-therachat-privacy-policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection by submitting a request to opt-out of sales of Personal Information, and they can also ask to delete the Personal Information collected by emailing hello@therachat.io.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states that users can opt out of data collection and request deletion of their data by contacting a specified email address.
reply.reference: You can submit a request to opt-out of sales of your Personal Information as described above... Deletion. You can ask us to delete the Personal Information that we have collected from you by emailing us at hello@therachat.io. URL: https://therachat.freshdesk.com/support/solutions/articles/151000117681-therachat-privacy-policy

Connecticut Data Privacy Act (“CTDPA”) effective as of July 1, 2023. The CTDPA provides Connecticut residents with the following rights regarding the personal data:
Right to confirm and access- The CTDPA grants consumers the right to access data from data controllers.
Right to correct- CTDPA provides consumers with the right to correct any inaccuracies in their data.
Right to data portability- Connecticut consumers can ask for a copy of the user data their company has saved and move it to anothe...

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties for various reasons such as with advertisers, Third-Party Ad Servers, and data providers for analysis and research as well as for facilitation of targeted content and ads.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app shares non-personal information with third parties like advertisers, Third-Party Ad Servers, and data providers for specific purposes.
reply.reference: We may also disclose Non-Personal Information... With our advertisers for their own analysis...With Third-Party Ad Servers to place our ads on Therachat and on third-party platforms or mobile applications. reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app may share data with data providers, partners, and vendors.

reply.analysis: The answer is derived from the section that mentions sharing of information with data providers, de-identified data to partners, and services with vendors in the privacy policy.
reply.reference: Our sharing of information with the data providers described above may also constitute “sales” as defined under the CCPA. Any information shared with third parties is controlled by each data provider and you may need to opt-out from each data provider individually. URL: https://therachat.freshdesk.com/support/solutions/articles/151000117681-therachat-privacy-policy
